metadata.name: Cell Based Toxicology LabProcess mode
metadata.description: Crate-o mode capturing toxicology assays with explicit Bioschemas LabProcess workflow links. This mode organizes metadata into input groups that map to RO-Crate entities: Groups 1-4 capture Dataset-level metadata (admin, contributors, regulatory context, structure). Groups 5-6 define experimental materials (ChemicalSubstance, Sample entities). Groups 7-9 describe experimental steps that can be represented as LabProcess entities in a workflow sequence. Use Dataset.processSequence to link LabProcess instances chronologically, creating a machine-readable representation of your experimental workflow.
metadata.author: J.M. Houweling
metadata.license: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

inputGroups.name: General information
inputGroups.help: This is general information about the dataset that describes the assay. A data descriptor (https://fairplus.github.io/Data-Maturity/docs/Glossary/#dataset-descriptor) is a data structure that contains any information that describes a dataset, i.e. it is a record representing the dataset’s metadata.

inputGroups.name: Structure
inputGroups.help: How the parts of this RO-Crate relate, including specific case study, regulatory question, and workflow steps.

inputGroups.name: Chemical Information
inputGroups.help: Test substances associated with this assay.

inputGroups.name: Biological Model Information
inputGroups.help: This group specifies the biological target (cells or organisms) exposed to the chemical(s). Information entered here creates Sample entities that represent the actual biological materials used in your experiment. These Sample entities become inputs to your LabProcess workflow steps. For cell-based assays, link Samples to CellLine entities via 'sourceMaterial' to indicate their origin (e.g., Sample 'HepG2 cells, passage 12' isBasedOn CellLine 'HepG2').

inputGroups.name: Exposure Information
inputGroups.help: Specifications on how biological models are exposed to the chemical(s), e.g., details about the applied dose, route of exposure and type of application (e.g., as aerosol or dispersed). Information entered here can be used to populate a LabProcess entity representing the 'Exposure' step in your experimental workflow. The dose, duration, route, and control parameters become ParameterValue entities linked to that LabProcess. Consider creating one or more LabProcess entities to capture this information with temporal and material flow context.

inputGroups.name: Endpoint Readout Information
inputGroups.help: Specifies the test methods used to assess the chemical(s) impact on the biological model and contains most of the metadata, mainly instrument specifications. Information entered here should be captured in one or more LabProcess entities representing 'Measurement' or 'Assay' steps in your workflow. Use the LabProcess fields 'bioassayType' to link to BioAssay Ontology terms (e.g., 'cell viability assay', 'MTT assay') and 'measuresAopEvent' to link to AOP-Wiki key events (e.g., 'cell death', 'oxidative stress'). This creates semantic connections between your experimental data and toxicological knowledge frameworks.

inputGroups.name: Analysis and Statistics
inputGroups.help: Information about the data analysis methods and statistics, as well as the used software for data evaluation

inputs.name: additionalType
inputs.help: Indicate whether this dataset describes multiple assays (study) or one single assay.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Title of this toxicology dataset.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Narrative description of the assay, matching the BioStudies study description.

inputs.name: version
inputs.help: Version string for this dataset (RO-Crate) release.

inputs.name: dateModified
inputs.help: Last update timestamp for this dataset package.

inputs.name: datePublished
inputs.help: Release date for this dataset.

inputs.name: license
inputs.help: License or terms of reuse, ideally a URL.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: Identifiers for this dataset (e.g. DOI, internal accession).

inputs.name: citation
inputs.help: Citations associated with this dataset (e.g. related publications).

inputs.name: url
inputs.help: Primary project portal link.

inputs.name: vhp context
inputs.help: Contextual characteristics of this dataset. VHP specific.

inputs.name: Raw data
inputs.help: Raw experimental input files (e.g. instrumentation outputs).

inputs.name: Preprocessed data
inputs.help: Processed/derived files generated from the raw data.

inputs.name: tox:analysisScript
inputs.help: Scripts or software used to process/analyze the data.

inputs.name: tox:workflowDescription
inputs.help: CWL workflow description (workflow.cwl or tool.cwl).

inputs.name: tox:workflowMetadata
inputs.help: Workflow-level metadata (e.g. isa.workflow.xlsx or isa.datamap.xlsx).

inputs.name: tox:runDescription
inputs.help: Run-specific CWL description (run.cwl) or parameter file (run.yml).

inputs.name: tox:runMetadata
inputs.help: Run metadata spreadsheets (e.g. isa.run.xlsx or isa.datamap.xlsx).

inputs.name: tox:differentiationProtocol
inputs.help: Protocol for culturing/differentiating the biological model.

inputs.name: tox:assayProtocol
inputs.help: Protocol describing the assay execution/readout.

inputs.name: tox:exposureRoute
inputs.help: Route of exposure (e.g. inhalation, oral, dermal) applied in the assay.

inputs.name: tox:exposureDuration
inputs.help: Duration of the exposure including units (e.g. 24 h, 14 days).

inputs.name: tox:exposureConcentration
inputs.help: Nominal concentration, dose levels, or dosing scheme applied during exposure.

inputs.name: tox:exposureFrequency
inputs.help: Frequency or schedule of exposure (e.g. single, repeated, 3x per week).

inputs.name: tox:vehicle
inputs.help: Vehicle/solvent or dispersal medium used for dosing.

inputs.name: tox:controlDescription
inputs.help: Description of positive/negative/solvent control conditions.

inputs.name: tox:replicateCount
inputs.help: Number of biological/technical replicates per concentration or condition.

inputs.name: labProtocol
inputs.help: Link to a lab protocol relevant to this dataset.

inputs.name: AOP
inputs.help: Look up AOP on AOP-wiki by name or identifier.

inputs.name: Organism
inputs.help: Organism represented in the assay.

inputs.name: Organ
inputs.help: Organ studied or modelled.

inputs.name: Tissue
inputs.help: Tissue studied or modelled.

inputs.name: Test Chemical
inputs.help: Chemical substances tested in this assay. Create ChemicalSubstance entities for each test compound, control, or vehicle used. These can be referenced as inputs in your LabProcess workflow steps.

inputs.name: Biological sample
inputs.help: Cell line or cellular model used.

inputs.name: AopEvent
inputs.label: AOP event
inputs.help: Key events from the referenced AOP that are evidenced by this dataset.

inputs.name: Key event relationship
inputs.help: Key event relationships from AOP-Wiki that are referenced in this dataset.

inputs.name: Author
inputs.help: Authors associated with the dataset.

inputs.name: BioAssay
inputs.help: Categorization of the general class of bioassay (enyzme activity, gene expression...)

inputs.name: funding
inputs.help: Funding.

inputs.name: affiliation
inputs.help: Affiliated organisations for the dataset team.

inputs.name: isPartOf
inputs.help: Larger collections of datasets(study) that this dataset(assay) is part of.

inputs.name: hasPart
inputs.help: Folder or File that form part of this dataset.

inputs.name: Process sequence
inputs.help: Ordered LabProcess references describing the assay workflow. Create LabProcess entities for key experimental steps (e.g., 'Cell Culture', 'Chemical Exposure', 'Endpoint Measurement', 'Data Analysis'). Each LabProcess should reference a LabProtocol (the method), specify inputs/outputs (Samples, ChemicalSubstances, Files), include parameterValues for this specific execution, and optionally link to bioassayType and measuresAopEvent for semantic enrichment. Link LabProcess instances here in chronological order to document your complete experimental workflow.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Full name of the contributor.

inputs.name: email
inputs.help: Contact email address.

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.help: Role performed by this contributor (e.g. Data Curator).

inputs.name: affiliation
inputs.help: Organisation affiliation.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: e.g. name of the research project

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Human-readable label for this property (e.g. 'Case study', 'Regulatory question', 'Workflow step').

inputs.name: propertyID
inputs.help: Identifier of the property type (e.g. VHP glossary URI for case study, regulatory question, or workflow step).

inputs.name: value
inputs.help: Human-readable value (e.g. case study title, short regulatory question label, workflow step label).

inputs.name: valueReference
inputs.help: Reference to the CaseStudy, RegulatoryQuestion, or WorkflowStep entity that this PropertyValue points to.

inputs.name: unitText
inputs.help: Unit, if applicable (often left empty for case study / regulatory links).

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Case study title

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: Identifier, study accession, or project code for this case study.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Description of the case study

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Short label for the regulatory question.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Narrative of the specific regulatory decision or question.

inputs.name: url
inputs.help: Reference link (e.g. guidance, dossier, or workflow documentation).

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Workflow step that this dataset contributes to.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Organisation name.

inputs.name: URL
inputs.help: Website for the organisation.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: Identifier such as ROR ID.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Name of the file.

inputs.name: contentUrl
inputs.help: URL to download or access the file.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Longer description of the role of this file within the crate.

inputs.name: conformsTo
inputs.help: Profile or schema this file conforms to (e.g. ISA-Tab, VCF spec).

inputs.name: encodingFormat
inputs.help: MIME type of the file.

inputs.name: additionalType
inputs.help: Classify this file using controlled URIs (e.g. http://edamontology.org/data_2044 for RawData, http://edamontology.org/data_1669 for ProcessedData, http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0001466 for study-aggregated outputs, http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0001477 for SOPs).

values.name: Study aggregated processed data
values.description: Study-wide aggregated or summarized processed data.

values.name: Metadata
values.description: Assay metadata templates or descriptive files.

inputs.name: contentSize
inputs.help: File size including units.

inputs.help: Name of the lab protocol.

inputs.name: reference
inputs.help: Link to the lab protocol.

inputs.name: intendedApplication
inputs.help: Short description of the lab protocol.

inputs.name: protocolType
inputs.help: Purpose or classification of this protocol.

inputs.name: components
inputs.help: Referenced reagents, equipment, or software required.

inputs.name: protocolParameters
inputs.help: Defined parameters used repeatedly in this protocol.

inputs.name: version
inputs.help: Protocol version identifier.

inputs.name: comment
inputs.help: Implementation notes or deviations.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Detailed description of the protocol steps.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Name of the Adverse Outcome Pathway (AOP).

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: Identifier or URL for the AOP.

inputs.name: hasPart
inputs.help: Associated AOP events.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Preferred label for the AOP event.

inputs.name: short_name
inputs.help: Short label or abbreviation for the event.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Narrative description or notes for the event.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: Identifier or URL for the AOP event.

inputs.name: eventType
inputs.help: Indicates whether the event is a key event or molecular initiating event.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Label describing the upstream and downstream events.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Additional notes on the key event relationship.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: Identifier or URL for the relationship.

inputs.name: upstream_event
inputs.help: Name of the upstream key event.

inputs.name: downstream_event
inputs.help: Name of the downstream key event.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Name of the software.

inputs.name: url
inputs.help: Link to the software homepage or repository.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Short description of how the software is used in this analysis.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Preferred chemical name.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Notes on purity, supplier, or batch.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: CAS, PubChem, or other identifiers.

inputs.name: hasRole
inputs.help: Role played by this chemical within the assay (test, control, vehicle, etc).

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Cell line or biological model name.

inputs.name: provider
inputs.help: Source or supplier of the cell line.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: BioAssay name or preferred label.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Description of the assay format.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: BAO identifier or URI.

inputs.name: detection instrument
inputs.help: detection instument used in this bioassay

inputs.name: detection instrument manufacturer
inputs.help: The role of a company as a creator of detection instrumentation.

inputs.name: assay kit
inputs.help: assay kit used in in this bioassay

inputs.name: assay protocol
inputs.help: the methodology used to perform a particular bioassay

inputs.name: endpoint
inputs.help: The endpoint is a quantitive or qualitative interpretable standardized representation of a perturbation (a change from a defined reference state of a closed model system) that is measured by the bioassay. An endpoint consists of a series of data points, one for each perturbing agent (screened entity) tested the assay.

inputs.name: measure entity
inputs.help: The role of a molecular entity of being the output of a biological reaction or process that is quantitated either directly (by the presence of a tag or probe) or indirectly in a coupled reaction.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Endpoint label.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Endpoint definition.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: Ontology identifier or URI.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Manufacturer name.

inputs.name: url
inputs.help: Link to the manufacturer site.

inputs.name: address
inputs.help: Headquarters or facility address.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Instrument name/model.

inputs.name: catalog number
inputs.help: The identifier assigned to a product, usually in the list of products published by a reseller or manufacturer.

inputs.name: manufacturer
inputs.help: Manufacturer reference.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: The title of the kit/biologicals used in the assay.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Measured entity or biomarker.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Notes about the measurement.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: Ontology identifier.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Workflow or tool name.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Summary of the workflow purpose.

inputs.name: url
inputs.help: Repository or CWL file location.

inputs.name: title
inputs.help: Title of the work.

inputs.name: author
inputs.help: Author(s) of the work.

inputs.name: url
inputs.help: Link to the work.

inputs.name: title
inputs.help: Article title.

inputs.name: author
inputs.help: Article authors.

inputs.name: datePublished
inputs.help: Publication date.

inputs.name: issn
inputs.help: Journal ISSN.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.help: DOI or other identifier.

inputs.name: creditText
inputs.help: Full textual citation supplied by DOI lookup.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Name of the assay or sub-assay.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Short description of the assay component.

inputs.name: category
inputs.help: Parameter category or label.

inputs.name: propertyID
inputs.help: Identifier or name of the property measured.

inputs.name: unitCode
inputs.help: Unit code referencing a standard vocabulary.

inputs.name: unitText
inputs.help: Human-readable unit.

inputs.name: value
inputs.help: Value or reference for the parameter.

inputs.name: valueReference
inputs.help: Reference object for this value (e.g. protocol, file).

inputs.name: annotationValue
inputs.help: Preferred label of the ontology term.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Optional description or scope notes.

inputs.name: termSource
inputs.help: Identifier or URI of the vocabulary/ontology.

inputs.name: termAccession
inputs.help: Accession or curie for the term.

inputs.name: termCode
inputs.help: Machine readable short code.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Sample name. This entity represents the actual biological material used in your experiment (e.g., 'HepG2 cells, passage 12, cultured in DMEM'). Samples flow through your LabProcess workflow as inputs and outputs. Use 'sourceMaterial' to link this sample to its origin (CellLine, ChemicalSubstance, or another Sample).

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Summary of the sample characteristics.

inputs.name: characteristics
inputs.help: Biological/chemical characteristics expressed as parameter values.

inputs.name: factors
inputs.help: Experimental factors applied to this sample.

inputs.name: sourceMaterial
inputs.help: Source material or reference from which this sample is derived. For chemical samples, link to the ChemicalSubstance entity. For biological samples, link to another Sample or CellLine.

inputs.name: derivesFrom
inputs.help: Parent sample, if applicable.

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Lab process name or label.

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Process summary and goal.

inputs.name: performer
inputs.help: Person or organization performing the process.

inputs.name: startTime
inputs.help: Process start time/date.

inputs.name: endTime
inputs.help: Process end time/date.

inputs.name: executesProtocol
inputs.help: Protocol executed by this process.

inputs.name: bioassayType
inputs.help: Type of bioassay being performed in this process (e.g., cell viability assay, gene expression assay).

inputs.name: measuresAopEvent
inputs.help: AOP key event(s) that this process measures or contributes evidence for (e.g., oxidative stress, DNA damage, cell proliferation).

inputs.name: inputs
inputs.help: Samples or materials entering the process.

inputs.name: outputs
inputs.help: Samples, intermediate materials, or data generated.

inputs.name: parameterValues
inputs.help: Process-specific parameter values.

inputs.name: identifer
inputs.help: Grant id

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: Name of the grant e.g. name of the funding programme

inputs.name: funder
inputs.help: Funding organisation
